result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 16CM545. Huber privileges for work and/or treatment. Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening. Credit for ZERO (0) time served.

miscConds.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees during the period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* No violent contact with the victim.  Any violation may result in additional charges.

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Anger Management.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIX (6) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO (0) time served.  CONSECUTIVE TO 16CM545.  Huber privileges for work and/or treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Defendant to participate in Anger Management.
* No violent contact with the victim.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees during the period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Filed, sdg.
At the request of the Defense,  matter is ADJOURNED to 4-27-2016 at 03:00 pm.  sdg

Attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

On Motion of the State,  Court CANCELLED JUSTICEPOINT DPA MONITORING.  Defendant to REMAIN on Pre-trial monitoring.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is adjourned to 04-20-2016 at 03:00 pm for Plea/Sentencing.  sdg
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has picked up a new charge.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense objected.  Court took the motion to revoke under advisement at this time.  Court is willing to accept Defendant's new matter into this Court PROVIDED that all Parties including the Court agree to the the transfer.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.
(8).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.  Review hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing on 11/9/15 at 8:30 am in Branch 33.

Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defendant is in the process of getting his TAD evaluation, date scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (7-18-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dale M. and his address.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Angel Elias Perez-Steffen in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
